alert.note: Alert for Alger; Delta; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 18 at 10:01AM EDT until May 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning for this afternoon and evening for central and eastern Upper Michigan... .DISCUSSION...Temperatures warm into the 60s, possibly closer to the 70 degree mark in some spots. Critical relative humidity values and winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 mph will result in dangerous fire weather conditions this afternoon and evening across much of eastern and central Upper Michigan. The strongest wind gusts will be across eastern Upper Michigan. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR CENTRAL UPPER MICHIGAN... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 005 Marquette, Fire Weather Zone 006 Alger and Fire Weather Zone 013 Delta. * Winds...South 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 25 percent. * Temperatures...In the lower to mid 60s. * Impacts...Burn restrictions are in effect. for more information on burn restrictions...visit the Michigan DNR website at http://www.michigan.gov/burnpermit...all lower case...or by calling 866-922-2876.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures and exceptionally dry fuels will create dangerous wildland fire conditions. Campfires, outdoor grills, smoking materials, chain saws, and all-terrain vehicles all have the potential to throw a spark and ignite a dangerous and destructive fire. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
